page.title: 14Rufforth Airfield.
page.content:
Rufforth airfield was first used in 1942}in the{1939_1945}war against Germany.{Number 158 Squadron}was based there.The Squadron was first formed in September {1918}somewhere in England (its intended role unknown).It was disbanded and then reformed in{1942. The Squadron used{Halifax aircraft.} Later, in February {1943 Spitfires}and {Hurricanes}arrived. A farmer and his wife died when a damaged{Halifax hit the farmhouse. {
In the{1950'S_1960'S}Meteor jets and{ {Anson}aircraft were based at Rufforth together with{Chipmunk trainers}of{ {Leeds University Air Squadron.}Then in the{1980's}the{Ouse Gliding Club} bought{63}acres for{Â£95,000}The hangar is now owned by{Greenbanks Haulage {Contractors. {
